ios.subtitle: The moving story of a lifetime

editorialNotes.standard: Movingâ€™s a drag! Relocate to this satisfying puzzler in which you unpack boxes filled with all sorts of goodies.
Pencil in time for nostalgic cannon duels in this hand-drawn reimagining of an old-school classic, where cannonballs fly while scribbled tumbleweeds bounce across graphite landscapes.

name: A Dance of Fire and Ice

ios.subtitle: Take It To The Next Level

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Mash through waves of foes as a heavily armed potato in this spud-tacular arena survival game.

Tiny Wings has been a longtime favorite of ours, thanks to its gentle vibe, fantastic music, and surprisingly awesome one-touch gameplay. Outrunning the sun across procedurally generated islands is rewarding and relaxing, and we love the added challenge of the four-bird race mode. The gameâ€™s vivid, vibrant colors absolutely dazzle on Apple TVâ€”we feel like weâ€™re meeting our flightless friends for the first time again.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Explore the nature of AIâ€”and learn a thing or two about yourselfâ€”in this snappy RPG that doubles as a personality test.

Ski Safari returns with an all-new look and the same addicting gameplay. Now you can hit the slopes as Sven's sister, Evana, boot up with a snowboard, and unlock all sorts of new power-ups. To outrun an impending avalanche youâ€™ll need to crash through cabins, team up with Yetis and eagles, and perform tons of tricks. The gameplay is as fast-paced as ever, and a fresh multiplayer mode and colorful new worlds to explore (like a prehistoric volcano) will keep you cruising down these mountains for a long time.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Railboundâ€™s tough puzzles are brilliantly focused. Youâ€™re given only a handful of rail tiles to guide train cars to the correct destinations in the correct order, and yet even with limited options the potential solutions feel limitless. Do you lay track so Car 4 goes through a tunnel and waits at a crossing gate for Cars 2 and 3 to pass? Do you create loops to delay Car 2? Do you ignore the crossing gate altogether? Few games make success feel like itâ€™s always just within reach, even when it isnâ€™t. A helpful hint system keeps the difficulty from going completely off the rails.

A game of survival, hope, and skill, Last Horizon sends you rocketing through space to reach a distant world. Stirring music and stylish minimalism set the mood for a big challenge: landing safely on other planets so your ship can collect resources. Youâ€™ll need careful timing to touch down softly enoughâ€”and to avoid asteroids and enemy vessels while you roam the cosmos.

editorialNotes.standard: Unleash your inner daredevil with Hello Gamesâ€™ electrifying new racing game, a fast-paced side-scroller bursting with fun challenges. As miniature stuntman Joe Danger and his crew of wacky drivers, youâ€™ll pop wheelies, sail off ramps, and even repel missiles and UFOs, snagging collectibles as you go for maximum points. With responsive controls and colorful stages, it'll hook anyone who appreciates an action-packed joyride.
With surreal illustrations and fruit-headed characters, this point-and-click adventure is as strange as it is clever.
With relaxed swapping rules and charming graphics, this surprisingly slick match-3 puzzler makes the genre feel fresh again.

editorialNotes.tagline: Our favourite love guru is back!

editorialNotes.tagline: Classics never go out of style

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: So much more than a simple action game, Duet elevates the act of dodging falling blocks into something captivating, beautiful, even profound. A stirring soundtrack and striking visuals almost guarantee youâ€™ll lose yourself in each stage, and as you learn the patterns and find yourself avoiding obstacles by sheer instinct, youâ€™ll feel an overwhelming surge of triumph.
editorialNotes.short: Two vessels play out lifeâ€™s duality.

editorialNotes.tagline: A deceptively deep game of survival
editorialNotes.standard: How do you build a kingdom? By galloping around and flinging gold at people, then seeing how they help you. Thatâ€™s the great thing about this deceptively deep survival gameâ€”how amazing you feel when you figure out everything from securing laborers to mounting defenses against monsters. And finding all the secrets (like a unicorn that drops gold) will keep you busy for ages.
editorialNotes.short: Charge into this captivating struggle to survive in hostile territory.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Developer Jan Ilavsky came up with the idea for this gorgeous Apple Design Award winner after heâ€™d broken his arm. He started on an infinite runner that could be played one-handed, and since heâ€™s also colorblind, he added a gameplay element about changing between vibrant neon colors. Chameleon Run succeeds beautifully, balancing wicked speed with irresistible, just-one-more-try challenges.
editorialNotes.short: You'll need quick reactions in this intense polychromatic platformer.

editorialNotes.standard: A well is usually one of the last things weâ€™d want to fall into, but this retro-style shooter has us jumping in again and again. Itâ€™s a rush descending from rock to rock, blasting creepy creatures with your gunboots while nabbing crimson gems. Roguelike difficulty means youâ€™re in for a challenge, but superb controls and nifty upgrades (including a jetpack, a drone, and laser sights) give you all the help youâ€™ll need. And with randomly generated levels, each journey feels as fresh and exciting as the last.

This clever physics-based puzzle game challenges you to spray water to extinguish fires and manipulate the environment. Its simple, clearly defined mechanics allow for intuitive, satisfying puzzle-solving. New elements are routinely layered in, ensuring that the challenges stay interesting. Great visuals and impressive sound also set Sprinkle Islands apart.
